triples.name: Markov chain
triples.relevance: Markov automata directly extend and compose Markov chains as a foundational modeling formalism.

triples.name: Discrete-time Markov chain
triples.relevance: Explicitly mentioned as a special case that Markov automata encompass.

triples.name: Continuous-time Markov chain
triples.relevance: Explicitly mentioned as a special case that Markov automata encompass.

triples.name: Probabilistic automaton
triples.relevance: Probabilistic automata are mentioned as related models that can be expressed within the Markov automata framework.

triples.name: Model checking
triples.relevance: The paper discusses numerical model checking procedures, which is the core algorithmic technique being applied.

triples.name: Probabilistic CTL
triples.relevance: PCTL is explicitly mentioned as one of the temporal logics used for specifying properties of Markov automata.

triples.name: Temporal logic
triples.relevance: Temporal logics (PCTL and CSL-like) are the formal specification languages for model checking Markov automata.

triples.name: Approximation algorithm
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a stable approximation scheme for computing time-bounded reachability probabilities.
